title: pr-3cf.2 COMPLETED
description:
Task pr-3cf.2 (Income Modeling: Throughput and Scenarios) is complete.

Created: research/03-income-modeling.md

Summary:
- Throughput analysis: 2,000-2,500 words/hour sustainable for clean fiction
- Three income scenarios modeled over 3 years
- Sensitivity analysis on rates, throughput, and capacity utilization
- Real-world constraints: seasonal variability, burnout limits, client acquisition challenges
- Key finding: Starting rates produce $10/hour effective. Market rates ($0.02+) required for viability
- 3-year minimum timeline to full-time income

title: epic
description:
Comprehensive viability study of craft-based occupations that:
- Can be done from home (â¤ one-car garage)
- Solo operator, no employees
- Quiet residential compatible
- No heavy industrial equipment
- Target: $40,000/year realistic income

Deliverables:
- /reports/home_craft_viability_study.pdf
- /reports/craft_income_models.csv
- /reports/sources.md
- /reports/methodology.md

title: task
description:
Generate wide list (50-80) of craft-based occupations including:
- woodworking (small-scale), bookbinding, instrument repair
- furniture repair/refinishing, leatherworking, printmaking
- ceramics, metal craft (light), textile/fiber arts
- restoration/repair crafts

Exclude: large-space trades, noisy industrial work, viral-marketing-dependent crafts

Output: /docs/craft_longlist.md

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research traditional and production crafts:
- Woodworking (small items, boxes, utensils)
- Leatherworking (bags, belts, accessories)
- Ceramics/pottery
- Metalwork (jewelry, small forging)
- Textile/fiber arts (weaving, knitting, dyeing)
- Candle/soap making
- Glasswork (lampwork, fused glass)

For each: note space/noise requirements, market size, typical pricing

Output: section of /docs/craft_longlist.md

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research repair, restoration, and specialty crafts:
- Bookbinding/book repair
- Instrument repair (guitar, violin, piano tuning)
- Furniture repair/refinishing
- Clock/watch repair
- Electronics repair (vintage audio, etc.)
- Shoe repair/cobbling
- Upholstery
- Frame making/gilding
- Knife/tool sharpening
- Printmaking/letterpress

For each: note space/noise requirements, market size, typical pricing

Output: section of /docs/craft_longlist.md

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

For each promising craft document:
- Required skill level
- Time to basic competence
- Time to professional competence
- Tooling and startup cost
- Space requirements
- Learning pathways (self-study, apprenticeship, courses)

Output: /docs/craft_training_and_tools.md

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Identify real buyers (consumers, businesses, institutions)
Assess: local vs online demand, competition density, price sensitivity
Identify: under-served niches, repair/restoration opportunities
Flag oversaturated crafts

Output: /docs/craft_market_analysis.md

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

For each shortlisted craft:
- Define pricing structures
- Estimate realistic throughput (units/week or hours/week)
- Build income models: conservative, realistic, optimistic
- Show hours required to reach $40k
- Identify bottlenecks and scaling limits

Output: /reports/craft_income_models.csv

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Identify physical strain risks for each craft
Assess: suitability into older age, injury likelihood, pacing flexibility
Identify crafts that allow: part-time scaling, seasonal adjustment, rest without collapse

Output: /docs/craft_longevity.md

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Narrow to top 10-15 crafts
Rank by: income viability, training burden, physical sustainability, market stability, workshop fit
For each: why it works, who it's not for, realistic downsides, first concrete steps

Output: /docs/final_craft_rankings.md

title: task
description:
Compile into /reports/home_craft_viability_study.pdf
Include: executive summary, methodology, ranked craft profiles, income math tables, final recommendations
Ensure calm, factual tone

Also produce:
- /reports/sources.md
- /reports/methodology.md (update for this study)

title: epic
description:
Rigorous feasibility study for k gross annual income hand-tool woodworking business.

Constraints:
- Primary work with hand tools
- Power tools only for rough dimensioning
- One-car garage or smaller
- Sustainable long-term
- Fewer, higher-value pieces

Deliverables:
- /reports/hand_tool_woodworking_training_program.pdf
- /reports/hand_tool_woodworking_business_plan.pdf  
- /reports/hand_tool_woodworking_viability_study.pdf
- /reports/references.md
- /reports/methodology.md

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Research and document:
- Historical and modern hand-tool woodworking businesses
- Contemporary craftspeople earning a living without industrial tooling
- Typical product categories for hand-tool shops (furniture, built-ins, repair/restoration, small batch goods)
- Pricing realities and client expectations
- Physical demands and long-term sustainability

Avoid influencer narratives. Prefer real shop accounts and credible sources.

Deliverable: Research document with sources for /reports/references.md

title: task

title: task
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Design a shop for one-car garage or smaller:
- Essential hand tools with rationale
- Minimal power tools for dimensioning only
- Workbench design
- Storage strategy  
- Dust/noise considerations
- Startup cost estimates
- Ongoing maintenance costs

Explicitly exclude unnecessary tools.

Deliverable: Shop design section for business plan
close_reason: Shop design complete. Created reports/shop_design_garage.md with comprehensive one-car garage hand-tool woodworking shop design including: tool lists with costs, workbench specifications, layout diagram, phased acquisition strategy, and explicit exclusions. Total startup: $4,050-$7,730. Annual maintenance: $210-$415.
